Package utilities

Class Vector2D

java.lang.Object
utilities.Vector2D
public final class Vector2D extends Object
A 2D Cartesian vector.
Also somewhat compatible with java.awt.Point.

Based on some sample code provided by Dr. Dimitri Ognibene as part of the CE218 Computer Games Programming module I took last year.

This version of the Vector2D has been signficantly trimmed down for sake of performance and the sanity of everyone reading the documentation.

The pre-trim version can be seen here: https://cseegit.essex.ac.uk/ce301_2020/ce301_lowe_richard_m/-/blob/2023c8cc0d74d6c3f30b769a469a4f97061fe317/src/utilities/Vector2D.java
Author:
Rachel Lowe

    • add

      public static Vector2D add​(Vector2D v, double x, double y)
      add coordinate values to vector
      Parameters:
      v - the vector that's having the stuff added to a copy of it
      x - x value to add to vector
      y - y value to add to vector
      Returns:
      a copy of v but with (x,y) added to it

      public static Vector2D subtract​(Vector2D v1, Vector2D v2)
      subtract argument vector (subtracts v1 from v2) but not modifying original
      Parameters:
      v1 - the left hand side (will be copied)
      v2 - the right hand side
      Returns:
      (copy of v1) - v2

    • randomVectorFromOrigin

      public static Vector2D randomVectorFromOrigin​(Vector2D origin, double minDist, double rangeDist)
      random vector which has been offset from the origin in a random direction by a random distance
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin vector that this vector is offset from
      minDist - the minimum magnitude for this random vector
      rangeDist - the range of magnitudes for this random vector
      Returns:
      that random vector

      Parameters:

      rangeDist - range of lengths
      Returns:
      this random polar vector

    • ensureThisIsInBounds

      public Vector2D ensureThisIsInBounds​(Vector2D minimumXY, Vector2D maximumXY)
      Given two vectors (max xy and min xy), this method will ensure that this vector is within those bounds.
      Parameters:
      minimumXY - the lower bounds of x and y
      maximumXY - the upper bounds of x and y
      Returns:
      this vector, but in the bounds of the given minimumXY and maximumXY

      compare for equality (note Object type argument)
      Overrides:
